result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Herbert Messerschmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit DNA sample within 30 days and pay surcharge 
Domestic violence counseling
No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1
Maintain absolute sobriety; no possession or consumption of any alcohol
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent 
Credit= 2 days (if revoked)
Costs to be paid through Probation
Defendant is to contact Probation office is Portage, WI by 4pm Tuesday 05-03-2022

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Herbert Messerschmidt

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

4:20 PM Defendant Charles Herbert Messerschmidt in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 1.  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.  Defendant agrees.Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and waives their right to an attorney.  Court finds waiver of attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = $243.00
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00
*Domestic Abuse Surcharge = $100.0
*Domestic Violence Counseling
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
*Credit = 2 days (if revoked)

Costs to be paid through Probation
Defendant is to contact the Probation office in Portage, WI by 4:00pm, Tuesday 5/3/22

Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.

1:10 PM Defendant Charles Herbert Messerschmidt appeared by video.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Juech did send an offer.  Defendant received an offer from the State and would like to accept the offer.  

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing
bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on March 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
*No violent or abusive contact with victim 1.    *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, including no possession or consumption of any alcohol .

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint and waives.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.   Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

03:32 PM Defendant Charles Herbert Messerschmidt appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.
Attu Burdon requests $500 signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court orders $500 signature bond with conditions  Status hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
